cohort: NSCLC patients, anti-PD-1 in 2L+, by Payer (2024-2025)
summary: Medicaid patients have only 42% anti-PD-1 utilization, 23% below peer average. Addressing access barriers could yield $950,000/year.

clinical_impact.description: Improving Medicaid access to anti-PD-1 therapy improves survival.

peer_comparison.description: Top-performing centers achieve 62% Medicaid anti-PD-1 utilization through specialized access programs. Your Medicaid rate of 42% is 20% below these leaders. Implementing peer strategies could yield $1,200,000/year in additional revenue while improving care equity.
action_steps: Implement top-performer Medicaid specialty pharmacy workflow
Create dedicated Medicaid immunotherapy coordinator position
Develop peer-based appeals process for Medicaid denials
Establish accelerated Medicaid authorization pathway for eligible patients
Connect Medicaid patients to assistance programs
suggestions: Negotiate with Medicaid for improved coverage
